CostsCurrentPeriod.name: CostsCurrentPeriod
CostsCurrentPeriod.description: Total cost for the current year and period

CostsCurrentYear.name: CostsCurrentYear
CostsCurrentYear.description: Total cost for the current year

CostsPreviousYear.name: CostsPreviousYear
CostsPreviousYear.description: Total cost for the previous year

CostsPreviousYearPeriod.name: CostsPreviousYearPeriod
CostsPreviousYearPeriod.description: Total cost for the previous year and period

ResultCurrentPeriod.name: ResultCurrentPeriod
ResultCurrentPeriod.description: Results of current year and period

ResultPreviousYearPeriod.name: ResultPreviousYearPeriod
ResultPreviousYearPeriod.description: Results of previous year and period

RevenueCurrentPeriod.name: RevenueCurrentPeriod
RevenueCurrentPeriod.description: Total revenue for the current year and period

RevenueCurrentYear.name: RevenueCurrentYear
RevenueCurrentYear.description: Total revenue for the current year

RevenuePreviousYear.name: RevenuePreviousYear
RevenuePreviousYear.description: Total revenue for the previous year

RevenuePreviousYearPeriod.name: RevenuePreviousYearPeriod
RevenuePreviousYearPeriod.description: Total revenue for the previous year and period

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint if you want to know the financial result of the current and previous year. The current period is determined by checking the date of the endpoint execution against the Financial Year/Period setup.  E.g. Date of Endpoint execution = 24-oct-2019. In your administration, the financial year 2019 period 10 has the following setup of 01-10-2019 till 31-10-2019. Current year is 2019,  current period is 10. Previous year is 2018. previous period is 10. Only P&L G/L Accounts are considered for this endpoint. Costs are balances of all G/L Account of type Costs. Revenue are balances of all G/L Account of type Revenue. Results are calculated by subtracting cost from revenue.  For more information about profit and loss, kindly refer to the following help file Balance Sheet/Profit & Loss.

documentation.llm_data_description: Provides key P&L metrics including total revenue, costs, and profit/loss results for current and previous periods/years. Essential for understanding company financial performance and period-over-period comparisons.
documentation.llm_description: Retrieve profit and loss overview data including costs and revenues for current and previous periods/years

AmountDC.name: AmountDC
AmountDC.description: Budget amount (always in the default currency of the company)

Costcenter.name: Costcenter
Costcenter.description: Used for cost center-specific budgets - NULL otherwise

Costunit.name: Costunit
Costunit.description: Used for cost unit-specific budgets - NULL otherwise

HID.name: HID
HID.description: Numerical ID. Never displayed to the user, but it may have its use for performance reasons

Item.name: Item
Item.description: Used for item-specific budgets - NULL otherwise

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to get the budgets that you have allocated to a G/L account in your administration. For more information about budget, you can refer to Budgets.

documentation.llm_data_description: Returns budget allocations by G/L account, cost center, and cost unit with scenario planning. Shows budgeted amounts, responsible parties, and reporting periods - crucial for budget monitoring and variance analysis.
documentation.llm_description: Access budget allocations for G/L accounts, cost centers, cost units and items with scenario planning

Account.name: Account
Account.description: The customer from which the receivable will come.

AccountBankAccountID.name: AccountBankAccountID
AccountBankAccountID.description: The bank account of the customer, from which the receivable will come.

AccountBankAccountNumber.name: AccountBankAccountNumber
AccountBankAccountNumber.description: The bank account number of the customer, from which the receivable will come.

AccountCode.name: AccountCode
AccountCode.description: The code of the customer from which the receivable will come.

AccountContact.name: AccountContact
AccountContact.description: Contact person copied from the purchase invoice linked to the related purchase entry.

AccountContactName.name: AccountContactName
AccountContactName.description: Name of the contact person of the customer.

AmountDC.name: AmountDC
AmountDC.description: The amount in default currency (division currency). Receivables are matched on this amount.

AmountDiscountDC.name: AmountDiscountDC
AmountDiscountDC.description: The amount of the discount in the default currency.

AmountDiscountFC.name: AmountDiscountFC
AmountDiscountFC.description: The amount of the discount. This is in the amount of the selected currency.

AmountFC.name: AmountFC
AmountFC.description: The amount of the receivable. This is in the amount of the selected currency.

BankAccountID.name: BankAccountID
BankAccountID.description: Own bank account to which the receivable will be done.

BankAccountNumber.name: BankAccountNumber
BankAccountNumber.description: Own bank account number to which the receivable will be done.

CashflowTransactionBatchCode.name: CashflowTransactionBatchCode
CashflowTransactionBatchCode.description: When processing receivables, all receivable with the same processing data are put in a batch. This field contains the code of that batch.

Currency.name: Currency
Currency.description: The currency of the receivable. This currency can only deviate from the division currency if the module Currency is in the license.

DirectDebitMandate.name: DirectDebitMandate
DirectDebitMandate.description: Direct Debit Mandate used to collect the receivable.

DirectDebitMandatePaymentType.name: DirectDebitMandatePaymentType
DirectDebitMandatePaymentType.description: Payment type of the mandate. 0 = One off payment 1 = Recurrent payment.

DirectDebitMandateType.name: DirectDebitMandateType
DirectDebitMandateType.description: Type of the mandate. 0 = Core 1 = Business-to-business.

DiscountDueDate.name: DiscountDueDate
DiscountDueDate.description: Date before which the payment by the customer must be done to be eligible for discount.

Document.name: Document
Document.description: Document that is created when processing collections.  The bank export file is attached to the document.

DueDate.name: DueDate
DueDate.description: Date before which the payment by the customer must be done.

EndDate.name: EndDate
EndDate.description: Date since when the receivable is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest invoice date of all matched receivables.

EndPeriod.name: EndPeriod
EndPeriod.description: Period since when the receivable is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest period of all matched receivables.

EndToEndID.name: EndToEndID
EndToEndID.description: The value of the tag 'EndToEndID' when generating a SEPA file.

EndYear.name: EndYear
EndYear.description: Year (of period) since when the receivable is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest year of all matched receivables. Used in combination with EndPeriod.

EntryID.name: EntryID
EntryID.description: The unique identifier for a set of receivables. A receivable can be split so that one part is received on a different date. In that case the two records get a different EntryID.

EntryNumber.name: EntryNumber
EntryNumber.description: Entry number of the linked transaction.

GLAccount.name: GLAccount
GLAccount.description: G/L account of the payment. Must be of type 20 (Accounts receivable).

InvoiceDate.name: InvoiceDate
InvoiceDate.description: Invoice date of the linked transaction.

InvoiceNumber.name: InvoiceNumber
InvoiceNumber.description: Invoice number of the linked transaction.

IsBatchBooking.name: IsBatchBooking
IsBatchBooking.description: Boolean indicating whether the receivable is part of a batch booking.

IsFullyPaid.name: IsFullyPaid
IsFullyPaid.description: Boolean indicating whether the receivable was fully paid by the customer.

OrderNumber.name: OrderNumber
OrderNumber.description: Order number of the linked transaction.

PaymentCondition.name: PaymentCondition
PaymentCondition.description: Payment condition of the linked transaction.

PaymentDays.name: PaymentDays
PaymentDays.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date.

PaymentDaysDiscount.name: PaymentDaysDiscount
PaymentDaysDiscount.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date of the discount.

PaymentInformationID.name: PaymentInformationID
PaymentInformationID.description: PaymentInformationID tag from the SEPA xml file.

PaymentMethod.name: PaymentMethod
PaymentMethod.description: Method of payment. B = On credit (default) I = Collection K = Cash V = Credit card

PaymentReference.name: PaymentReference
PaymentReference.description: Payment reference for the receivable that may be included In the bank export file

RateFC.name: RateFC
RateFC.description: Exchange rate from receivable currency to division currency. AmountFC * RateFC = AmountDC.

ReceivableBatchNumber.name: ReceivableBatchNumber
ReceivableBatchNumber.description: Number assigned during the processing of receivables.

ReceivableSelected.name: ReceivableSelected
ReceivableSelected.description: Date and time since when the receivable is selected to be collected.

ReceivableSelector.name: ReceivableSelector
ReceivableSelector.description: User who selected the receivable to be collected.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The status of the receivable. 20 = open 30 = selected - receivable is selected to be collected 40 = processed - collection has been done 50 = matched - receivable is matched with one or more other outstanding items or financial statement lines

TransactionAmountDC.name: TransactionAmountDC
TransactionAmountDC.description: Total amount of the linked transaction in default currency (division currency).

TransactionAmountFC.name: TransactionAmountFC
TransactionAmountFC.description: Total amount of the linked transaction in the selected currency.

TransactionDueDate.name: TransactionDueDate
TransactionDueDate.description: Due date of the linked transaction.

TransactionEntryID.name: TransactionEntryID
TransactionEntryID.description: Linked transaction. Use this as reference to SalesEntries.

TransactionID.name: TransactionID
TransactionID.description: Linked transaction line. Use this as reference to SalesEntryLines.

TransactionIsReversal.name: TransactionIsReversal
TransactionIsReversal.description: Indicates if the linked transaction is a reversal entry.

YourRef.name: YourRef
YourRef.description: Invoice number. In case the receivable belongs to a bank entry line and is matched with one invoice, YourRef is filled with the YourRef of this invoice.

endpoint_info.good_to_know:
Use this endpoint to get an overview of all the payment to be received in your administration. Paymentlines are grouped by own bank account, account bank account, payment reference, payment method, entry date and status. Payments of one entry have the same TransactionId. Among other things, with this endpoint you can get information like the payments status (e.g. Open, Processed) or when is the collection is due.
This bulk service has a page size of 1000.
It is mandatory to provide the $select query option with a selection of one or more of the resource properties.
Only the following filters are supported for this endpoint:
Account, Document, EndDate, EndToEndID, EntryDate, EntryID, GLAccount, ID, InvoiceDate, InvoiceNumber, Source, Status, TransactionID, TransactionType

documentation.llm_data_description: Lists all outstanding customer payments with amounts, due dates, payment status, and collection information. Critical for cash flow management and tracking overdue invoices.
documentation.llm_description:
Use this endpoint to get an overview of all the payment to be received in your administration. Paymentlines are grouped by own bank account, account bank account, payment reference, payment method, entry date and status. Payments of one entry have the same TransactionId. Among other things, with this endpoint you can get information like the payments status (e.g. Open, Processed) or when is the collection is due.
This bulk service has a page size of 1000.
It is mandatory to provide the $select query option with a selection of one or more of the resource properties.
Only the following filters are supported for this endpoint:
Account, Document, EndDate, EndToEndID, EntryDate, EntryID, GLAccount, ID, InvoiceDate, InvoiceNumber, Source, Status, TransactionID, TransactionType

Amount.name: Amount
Amount.description: The sum of the amounts of all transactions in the grouping.

AmountCredit.name: AmountCredit
AmountCredit.description: The sum of the amounts of all credit transactions in the grouping.

AmountDebit.name: AmountDebit
AmountDebit.description: The sum of the amounts of all debit transactions in the grouping.

BalanceType.name: BalanceType
BalanceType.description: Balance type of the G/L account: B = Balance Sheet, W = Profit & Loss.

CostCenterCode.name: CostCenterCode
CostCenterCode.description: The code of the cost center.

CostCenterDescription.name: CostCenterDescription
CostCenterDescription.description: The description of the cost center.

CostUnitCode.name: CostUnitCode
CostUnitCode.description: The code of the cost unit.

CostUnitDescription.name: CostUnitDescription
CostUnitDescription.description: The description of the cost unit.

Count.name: Count
Count.description: The number of transactions in the grouping.

GLAccountCode.name: GLAccountCode
GLAccountCode.description: The code of the G/L account.

GLAccountDescription.name: GLAccountDescription
GLAccountDescription.description: The description of the G/L account.

ReportingPeriod.name: ReportingPeriod
ReportingPeriod.description: The reporting period of the transactions in the grouping.

ReportingYear.name: ReportingYear
ReportingYear.description: The reporting year of the transactions in the grouping.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: Status: 20 = Open, 50 = Processed. To get 'after entry' results, both Open and Processed amounts have to be included. This is by default, so it requires no extra filtering.

Type.name: Type
Type.description: The type of the transactions in the grouping.

endpoint_info.good_to_know: This service returns summarized data of financial transactions. It's intended for reporting balances and period totals. The summarized amounts are grouped by: Division, ReportingYear, ReportingPeriod, G/L account, Cost center, Cost unit, Type, Status. For optimal filter, only include a reporting year in the filter.

documentation.llm_data_description: Provides summarized financial transaction data grouped by G/L account, cost center, and period. Shows debit/credit amounts and transaction counts - essential for balance sheet and detailed financial analysis.
documentation.llm_description: This service returns summarized data of financial transactions. It's intended for reporting balances and period totals. The summarized amounts are grouped by: Division, ReportingYear, ReportingPeriod, G/L account, Cost center, Cost unit, Type, Status. For optimal filter, only include a reporting year in the filter.

BankStatementDocument.name: BankStatementDocument
BankStatementDocument.description: Reference to document with bank statement

BankStatementDocumentNumber.name: BankStatementDocumentNumber
BankStatementDocumentNumber.description: Document number of document with bank statement

BankStatementDocumentSubject.name: BankStatementDocumentSubject
BankStatementDocumentSubject.description: Subject of document with bank statement

ClosingBalanceFC.name: ClosingBalanceFC
ClosingBalanceFC.description: Closing balance in the currency of the transaction

FinancialPeriod.name: FinancialPeriod
FinancialPeriod.description: The period of the transaction lines. The period should exist in the period date table

FinancialYear.name: FinancialYear
FinancialYear.description: The financial year to which the entry belongs. The financial year should exist in the period date table

OpeningBalanceFC.name: OpeningBalanceFC
OpeningBalanceFC.description: Opening balance in the currency of the transaction

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to create, delete or read bank entries for the bank statements received. Note: Bank entries are separated to header and line information. Endpoint BankEntries is used for the header information. You must include a parameter for 'BankEntryLines' to add cash entry lines when you POST to the BankEntries endpoint.Bank entries have an opening balance which should be the end balance of the previous entry. Opening balance plus all bank entry lines should result in the closing balance.

documentation.llm_data_description: Contains bank statement transactions with opening/closing balances, transaction lines, and journal entries. Key for bank reconciliation and cash position monitoring.
documentation.llm_description: Access bank transaction entries and financial transaction records

AmountInTransit.name: AmountInTransit
AmountInTransit.description: Amount in transit - The amount that you have requested your bank to pay

ApprovalStatus.name: ApprovalStatus
ApprovalStatus.description:
Approval status:
						null - Invoice was entered before approval functionality was activated (treated as Approved for payments)
						1 - N/A (used for non-electronic payment methods)
						2 - Awaiting review
						3 - Awaiting approval
						4 - Approved

DueDate.name: DueDate
DueDate.description: Date the invoice is due (This due date is not the discount due date)

EntryNumber.name: EntryNumber
EntryNumber.description: The entry number of this payment term corresponding purchase/cashflow entry

InvoiceDate.name: InvoiceDate
InvoiceDate.description: The date of the invoice or the date when money is paid to the supplier

InvoiceNumber.name: InvoiceNumber
InvoiceNumber.description: For purchase entry, it would be the entrynumber. For the cashflow entry, it will be entrynumber of an invoice which this payment is for

YourRef.name: YourRef
YourRef.description: Purchase invoice Your Reference number. Will be null if it is a cashflow entry

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to get all your suppliers payment terms information. Payment term are created when an purchase invoice is created or when money is paid to the supplier.You can view this information in the Outstanding items report as well.

documentation.llm_data_description: Shows all supplier payment obligations with amounts due, payment terms, approval status, and due dates. Essential for accounts payable management and cash flow planning.
documentation.llm_description: Retrieve accounts payable information and outstanding payment obligations

ArchiveDate.name: ArchiveDate
ArchiveDate.description: Date on which the division is archived

BlockingStatus.name: BlockingStatus
BlockingStatus.description: Values: 0 = Not blocked, 1 = Backup/restore, 2 = Conversion busy, 3 = Conversion shadow, 4 = Conversion waiting, 5 = Copy data waiting, 6 = Copy data busy

Class_01.name: Class_01
Class_01.description: First division classification. User should have access rights to view division classifications.

Class_02.name: Class_02
Class_02.description: Second division classification. User should have access rights to view division classifications.

Class_03.name: Class_03
Class_03.description: Third division classification. User should have access rights to view division classifications.

Class_04.name: Class_04
Class_04.description: Fourth division classification. User should have access rights to view division classifications.

Class_05.name: Class_05
Class_05.description: Fifth division classification. User should have access rights to view division classifications.

Country.name: Country
Country.description: Country of the division. Is used for determination of legislation

CustomerCode.name: CustomerCode
CustomerCode.description: Owner account code of the division

CustomerName.name: CustomerName
CustomerName.description: Owner account name of the division

HID.name: HID
HID.description: Number that customers give to the division

OBNumber.name: OBNumber
OBNumber.description: The soletrader VAT number used for offical returns to tax authority

StartDate.name: StartDate
StartDate.description: Date on which the division becomes active

Status.name: Status
Status.description: Regular administrations will have status 0.  Currently, the only other possibility is 'archived' (1), which means the administration is not actively used, but still needs to be accessible for the customer/accountant to meet legal obligations

TaxOfficeNumber.name: TaxOfficeNumber
TaxOfficeNumber.description: Number of your local tax authority (Germany)

Website.name: Website
Website.description: Customer value, hyperlink to external website

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Returns only divisions that are accessible to the signed-in user, as configured in the user card under 'Companies: Access rights'. Accountants will only see divisions that belong to a single license (either their own or a client's), being the license that owns the division specified in the URI.Please note that divisions returned are only those which the user has granted permission to.Recommended alternative that is not limited to accessible divisions: /api/v1/{division}/system/AllDivisionsRecommended alternative that is not limited to a single license: /api/v1/{division}/system/Divisions

documentation.llm_data_description: Company organizational structure information including division details, currencies, countries, and VAT numbers. Important for multi-entity reporting and compliance.
documentation.llm_description: Access company division and organizational structure information

BICCode.name: BICCode
BICCode.description: The bank identification code of the bank

Country.name: Country
Country.description: The country in which the bank is based

Description.name: Description
Description.description: The extended description of the bank

Format.name: Format
Format.description: The account format used by the bank

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The status of the bank. A = Active, P = Passive

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to get all the banks that are supported by EOL.

documentation.llm_data_description: Master data of supported banks with identification codes and account formats. Used for payment processing and bank account setup.
documentation.llm_description: Access bank account information and banking details for cash flow management

Account.name: Account
Account.description: Account to which the mandate belongs.

Attachment.name: Attachment
Attachment.description: Contain attachment (Format: Base64 encoded) of the mandate belongs. Binaries are not sent in the response.

AttachmentFileName.name: AttachmentFileName
AttachmentFileName.description: Filename of the attachment to which the mandate belongs.

BankAccount.name: BankAccount
BankAccount.description: Bank account to which the mandate belongs.

CancellationDate.name: CancellationDate
CancellationDate.description: Date that the mandate is cancelled. Used to check the validity of the mandate.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: Displays the description of the mandate.

FirstSend.name: FirstSend
FirstSend.description: Indicates the first collection hasn't been sent/confirmed with this mandate.

Main.name: Main
Main.description: Indicates if the mandate is the main, you can have only one main mandate

PaymentType.name: PaymentType
PaymentType.description: Depending on the payment type, a different bank file will be generated. 0 = One-off payment, 1 = Recurrent payment, 2 = AdHoc (UK only)

Reference.name: Reference
Reference.description: Displays a reference number for the mandate. It is a unique reference number that you can assign to each mandate.

SignatureDate.name: SignatureDate
SignatureDate.description: Date that the mandate is signed. The collection must take place after the signature date of the mandate. The date is used to check the validity of the mandate.

Type.name: Type
Type.description: Depending on the type, a different bank file will be generated. 0 = Core, 1 = B2B and 2 = bottomline (UK only)

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to retrieve, create, update or delete a mandate of your administration. For more information about mandate, you can visit the following help file Mandates.

documentation.llm_data_description: Direct debit authorization details for automated payment collection including mandate status, payment types, and customer bank accounts.
documentation.llm_description: Handle direct debit mandates for automated payment collection processes

AmountDC.name: AmountDC
AmountDC.description: Amount in the default currency of the company

AmountFC.name: AmountFC
AmountFC.description: Amount in the currency of the transaction

AmountVATBaseFC.name: AmountVATBaseFC
AmountVATBaseFC.description: Vat base amount in the currency of the transaction

AmountVATFC.name: AmountVATFC
AmountVATFC.description: Vat amount in the currency of the transaction

DueDate.name: DueDate
DueDate.description: Date that payment should be done

EntryID.name: EntryID
EntryID.description: The transaction lines that make up a financial entry share the same EntryID

PaymentDiscountAmount.name: PaymentDiscountAmount
PaymentDiscountAmount.description: Discount amount when paid in time

Subscription.name: Subscription
Subscription.description: Reference to subscription line (Note: LineNumber greater than 0 is subscription line)

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to read all kind of transactions created in Exact.  Find more details on the attributes in the relevant topic description for BankEntries, CashEntries, GeneralJournalEntries, PurchaseEntries or SalesEntries.

documentation.llm_data_description: Detailed line-item data for all financial transactions including amounts, accounts, cost centers, and VAT. Provides granular transaction analysis and audit trail.
documentation.llm_description: Access detailed transaction line items and financial transaction details

ClosingBalanceFC.name: ClosingBalanceFC
ClosingBalanceFC.description: Closing balance in the currency of the transaction

FinancialPeriod.name: FinancialPeriod
FinancialPeriod.description: The period of the transaction lines. The period should exist in the period date table

FinancialYear.name: FinancialYear
FinancialYear.description: The financial year to which the entry belongs. The financial year should exist in the period date table

OpeningBalanceFC.name: OpeningBalanceFC
OpeningBalanceFC.description: Opening balance in the currency of the transaction

endpoint_info.good_to_know: Use this endpoint to create, delete or read cash entries.Note: Cash entries are separated to header and line information. Endpoint CashEntries is used for the header information. You must include a parameter for 'CashEntryLines' to add cash entry lines when you POST to the CashEntries endpoint.Cash entries have an opening balance which should be the end balance of the previous entry. Opening balance plus all cash entry lines should result in the closing balance.

documentation.llm_data_description: Cash transaction records with opening/closing balances and transaction details. Important for petty cash management and cash-based accounting.
documentation.llm_description: Manage cash transaction entries and cash-based financial records
